alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 22 at 3:17AM CDT until September 22 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches. * WHEN...From 2 PM CDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...High wave action can make swimming difficult on days such as this. Incoming waves in rapid succession can tire even an experienced swimmer quickly. Rip currents can usher you away from land. To avoid being swept away, swim parallel to the shore to exit a rip current. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light winds this morning are expected to become northeast and increase this afternoon. Waves up to 3 to 5 feet will be possible this afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
